==English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|en|vnd}} {{qualifier|alternative typography}} {{defdate|16th C.}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|en|enm|unde||a wave}}, from either the {{der|en|fro|unde}} or {{der|en|la|unda||wave}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/ ånd/}} * {{rhymes|en| ånd}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|obsolete|rare}} A [[wave]]. # {{lb|en|heraldry}} A [[billow]]- or wave-like marking. ====Related terms==== {{rel3|en|oundy |undade |undated |und√©e |undy |undulate |undulating}} ===References=== * ''{{w|OED}}'' (2nd ed., 1989), ‚Äú[http://oed.com/oed2/00264105 ‚Ä†und]‚Äù ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=dnu|DNU|dun}} ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|unt}}, {{l|de|vnd}}, {{l|de|vnnd}}, {{l|de|unnd}} {{qual|all obsolete}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|unde}}, from {{inh|de|goh|unti}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*andi}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*h‚ÇÇ√©nti}}. Compare {{cog|nl|en}}, {{cog|en|and}}, {{cog|da|end}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ änt/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ än/}} {{a|colloquially among many speakers}} * {{audio|de|De-und.ogg|audio}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # {{lb|de|co-ordinating}} [[and]] #: {{ux|de|Kaffee '''und''' Kuchen|t=coffee '''and''' cake}} #: {{ux|de|Ich kam, sah '''und''' siegte.|t=I came, saw, '''and''' conquered.}} #* '''1904''', Rudolf Eisler, ''W√∂rterbuch der philosophischen Begriffe'', Berlin, volume 1, sub verbo ''Ich'', page 446-457: #*: "Das ¬ªIch = Ich¬´ ist die urspr√ºnglichste Erkenntnis, die Urquelle alles Denkens [..], es bedeutet ¬ªerstens die rein logische Identit√§t von Subject '''und''' Object im Acte des reinen Selbstbewu√ütseins, zweitens die reale metaphysische Identit√§t des setzenden absoluten Ich '''und''' des gesetzten begrenzten Ich, '''und''' drittens die zeitliche Identit√§t des Ich in zwei rasch aufeinander folgenden Zeitpunkten¬´ [...]." # {{lb|de|colloquial}} {{non-gloss definition|links two nouns, often a person and an activity, in rhetoric questions to express an opposition between them}} #: {{ux|de|Er '''und''' Abwaschen? Vielleicht einmal im Jahr!|t=Him doing the dishes? Maybe once per year!}} ====Usage notes==== As seen in the second example, commas are never used before ''und'' in enumerations, even where English punctuation requires this. However, commas are used before ''und'' in certain complex sentence constructions. ===Interjection=== {{head|de|interjection}} # [[so]]?, [[now]]? #: {{ux|de|'''Und?'''
